entry.title: Raspberry Pi Pico W: your $6 IoT platform
entry.quote: Today, we’re launching three new members of the Pico family. Raspberry Pi Pico W is priced at $6, and brings 802.11n wireless networking to the Pico platform, while retaining complete pin compatibility with its older sibling.

entry.title: Why Passkeys Will Be Simpler and More Secure Than Passwords
entry.quote: Passkeys Bring the Benefits of Public-Key Cryptography to Everyday Logins

entry.title: Tesla hit by new lawsuit alleging racial abuse
entry.quote: Fifteen black former or current employees allege they faced racial abuse and harassment at carmaker’s factories

entry.title: NASA scientists say images from the Webb telescope nearly brought them to tears
entry.quote: Deep field images of the universe, exoplanet atmospheres, and more to be unveiled.

entry.title: How Amazon Branded Convenience and Normalized Monopoly
entry.quote: Emily West, a communication professor at UMass Amherst, examines Amazon’s consumer-facing services to investigate how the brand grew so quickly and attained a level of ubiquity in our lives while hiding in plain sight. Amazon, West argues, is very big in multiple respects, but prefers that we don’t notice.

entry.title: In Kenya, a community regrew its forest — and redefined reforestation success
entry.quote: What started as a group effort to find a solution to deforestation has seen a rural community in Kenya successfully regenerate 50% of their once denuded forest by planting at least 300,000 trees in just five years.
